intro: Hieracium hyalinum, commonly known as the ghostweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its pale, almost translucent leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Hieracium hyalinum is an annual or biennial plant, with a short life cycle that allows it to complete its growth and reproduction quickly.
